title: NextGen Braves Outing with Metro Atlanta YPs
location: 10000 Avalon Blvd., Suite 100 Alpharetta, GA 30009, USA
description: Join young professionals from the Greater North Fulton Chamber and Cobb Chamber as we enjoy drinks and networking followed by watching the Braves take on the Miami Marlins at Truist Park. The Cobb Chamber will host a tailgate with free drinks and light appetizers from 5:30 - 7:00 p.m. and then we will walk together to Truist Park to enjoy the game at 7:20 p.m.. Registration includes admission to the tailgate and a seat in our young professionals section (Coca-Cola Corner sec. 345) and a free Coke product at the game. When registering, please include the email at which you wish to receive your e-ticket . Tickets will be sent out a few days before game day. Young professionals are responsible for their own parking. Parking may be purchased here . If you'd like to park at the Cobb Chamber, they're located at Lot B11. Permit only; no drive-up parking allowed; must purchase a permit in advance. Uber and carpooling are highly encouraged. If you'd like to rideshare from Avalon, you're welcome to utilize GNFCC guest parking: gate code TBD # Tailgate (optional): 5:30 - 7:00 p.m. Game: 7:20 - 10:00 p.m. The Cobb Chamber will host a tailgate with free drinks and light appetizers from 5:30 - 7

title: NextGen Connect & Caffeinate at Serendipity Labs
location: 10000 Avalon Blvd., Suite 100 Alpharetta, GA 30009, USA
description: Join other North Fulton young professionals for networking, coffee, and breakfast at the Greater North Futon Chamber for NextGen Connect & Caffeinate. Build relationships, invest in your own professional development, and develop leads with us. Event registration includes coffee and light breakfast and is open to both Chamber members and non-members. NextGen Connects is a Chamber talent development initiative that serves to engage, recognize, and develop the Greater North Fulton Chamber of Commerce’s future leaders. This young professionals group is designed for individuals, ages 21 to 40, who are living and/or working in North Fulton. Interested in sponsoring or hosting a NextGen event? ﻿Contact Christy Hulsey to invest in North Fulton's future today: chulsey@gnfcc.com Events News Sponsorship Opportunities Join Membership Levels Member Benefits Member Directory

title: ProAlliance Networking Meeting
location: 10000 Avalon Blvd., Suite 100 Alpharetta, GA 30009, USA
description: You are invited to be a part of one of the largest networking groups in North Fulton. Build relationships, support professional development, and develop leads. This is an opportunity to network with other Chamber members and guests, share ideas, and grow your business. What to Expect: - Be prepared to speak for ~2 minutes to share more about yourself in a small group setting - Enjoy 6-minute presentations from two GNFCC members (all Chamber Members are eligible) - Be prepared to stand and give a ~25 second elevator pitch to all guests - Opportunity to donate swag items to giveaway to the crowd (simply bring item with you and give to facilitator) Please register by 4pm on the Tuesday prior to the meeting prior to be on the registration list. You may register until the start of the meeting at 7:30am. Registration is required for this event. ProAlliance Coffee Sponsor: 7:30am - 7:45am - Networking 7:45am - Meeting Begins 9:00am – Meeting Concludes Events News

title: Health & Wellness Seminar - Robotic Surgery in Women’s Healthcare
description: About the Seminar: Join Dr. Keshma Saujani, Longstreet Clinic to learn more about Robotic Surgery in Women’s Healthcare. Specifically, learn more about DaVinci robotic surgery in Gynecological Procedures and its benefits of it while in surgery. About the Speaker: Keshma Saujani, M.D., FACOG, is a board-certified obstetrician and gynecologist at Longstreet Clinic. She also holds board certification in minimally invasive GYN surgery. Dr. Saujani, who joined Longstreet Clinic in 2006, sees patients at offices in Gainesville and Braselton. She delivers obstetric patients and performs minimally invasive GYN surgery, including robotic procedures, at Northeast Georgia Medical Center in Gainesville, where she has also served as chair of OBGYN Services. To Register In Person use button on the side bar. Click Here to Register on Zoom RSVP is requested 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206

title: Health & Wellness Seminar - Thyroid Cancer in Northeast Georgia
description: About the Presentation: “Exceptionally high” thyroid cancer rates have been reported in many of the counties located in Northeast Georgia. This presentation will examine the epidemiology of thyroid cancer and address the work the University of North Georgia is planning on doing with community partners. About the Speaker: Dr. Neal Lin is an assistant professor in the Biology Department at the University of North Georgia. His expertise is in clinical epidemiology and public health, with a degree in microbiology, epidemiology and medicine. He has worked for about ten years at local and federal public health agencies on emergency preparedness and epidemiology of microbial diseases, including botulism. title: Small Business Seminar - Digital Marketing Now: Trends, Tools and Tactics That Work
description: About the Seminar: Feeling overwhelmed by marketing buzzwords or confused by declining website traffic? You’re not alone. Join Robbie Parks, UGA SBDC in this engaging session, you’ll discover the top 10 digital marketing trends driving small business success today. From artificial intelligence and generative engine optimization to the enduring power of email marketing, you’ll learn what actually works, and what you can safely ignore. Whether you’re looking to cut through the noise, stay ahead of the curve, or simply keep up with what’s new, you’ll leave with clear insights and practical strategies you can put to work right away. About the Speaker: Robbie Parks is a business consultant, facilitator, instructional designer, and nationally recognized speaker with the University of Georgia Small Business Development Center. In this role, she empowers entrepreneurs with the knowledge and strategies they need to be competitive in an ever-evolving business landscape. She specializes in helping small businesses navigate the complexities of digital transformation, from developing comprehensive marketing strategies to implementing cutting-edge AI solutions. title: Small Business Seminar - Fostering a Cybersecure Workspace Culture
description: Free for Chamber Members, Non-Members $15.00. Please RSVP. Join Abdul Hussain, Delta Community Credit Union to talk about "Fostering & Cybersecure Workplace". About the speaker: With multiple industry-leading IT and security certifications, Abdul Hussain has more than 20 years of experience developing IT security strategies and building infrastructure systems for large scale global enterprises. He serves as Vice President of Information Security and CISO for Delta Community Credit Union, Georgia’s largest credit union and one of the largest credit unions in the nation. Abdul previously served as manager of Technology, Strategy and Operations for Protiviti, where he led teams focusing on optimizing security operations for large financial services companies, as well as energy, healthcare, and hospitality industries. A Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) and a Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), Abdul holds a BS in Information Technology from Southern Polytechnic State University and an MBA from the Georgia Institute of Technology.
